alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"... But when it comes to ideas, there is a different need.  We need to teach a better process for developing big ideas that people can understand and use.  We need a process that enables people who are doing a stellar job in every other part of modern corporations to do a stellar job in developing new ideas.

In today's corporate environment, small ideas are encouraged and big ideas are discouraged.  The result is that we give up on good ideas too soon, and push bad ideas too long."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Why Breakthrough Ideas Are Hard to Foster - 2
